info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 03 at 6:44AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHERN RIPLEY AND SOUTHWESTERN DEARBORN COUNTIES THROUGH 715 AM EDT... At 644 AM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Versailles, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Half inch hail, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Lawrenceburg, Aurora, Versailles, Milan, Osgood, Dillsboro, Moores Hill, Wilmington, Manchester, Sunman, Mount Sinai, Rexville, Cold Springs, Benham, Weisburg, New Marion, Farmers Retreat, Friendship, Versailles Lake and Cross Plains. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...<35 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
